You may have already guessed but I think ants are amazing creatures, and one thing I love about them is how they communicate; ants are very social creatures. Their communication ranges from chemical signals to touch and even to noise! First lets discuss chemical signal communication. Ants release chemicals called pheromones which get released from  many different glands depending on the signals intention. These pheromones  can communicate food, shelter, danger, and much more.These signals are there captured by small hairs located on the antenna of the ant called antennal sensilla, which is an ants primary sensory organ.
